result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Christopher J Ellis appeared by phone.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for Christopher J Ellis.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the defendant's address and phone number. Defendant requests to have text notifications. Court questions defendant as to when he can get to Green Lake. Statement by defendant. Court sets for plea & sentencing on December 6, 2022 at 1:30 PM. Mandatory appearance or warrant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: (by Atty Michael Kapelis)
Second appearance on May 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

12:05 PM Defendant Christopher J Ellis appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over defendant's court record re: status of counsel. Defendant states he didn't know how to apply to the public defender's office. Court goes over the defendant's right to counsel and how to obtain one. court instructs defendant on how to apply for a public defender.  Court schedules Status of Counsel for May 31, 2022 at 3:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 12:07 AM
Second appearance on May 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:16 AM Defendant Christopher J Ellis appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Def states he is getting an attorney but the one he was looking at fell through. Court informs def he will give him time to obtain an attorney but not an indefinite amount of time. Court sets second appearance for May 3, 2022 at 11:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:17 AM.

Def called and stated he was stuck in Atlanta as he missed his flight to Wisconsin this morning and was looking to adjourn his Second Appearance court date on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Def stated he had an appointment to call an attorney today to retain them. Def was given zoom information.
Second appearance on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.                (wrong date on the bottom)
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:16 AM Defendant Christopher J Ellis appeared in court, Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court determines def stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on his behalf. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court will set for Status of Counsel Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:18 AM.
Warrant cancelled - spoke to Dave in dispatch.
Initial appearance on March 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Warrant cancelled - spoke to Dave in dispatch.
Letter from the def dated Feb 09, 2022 re: def has covid and requests court date be changed from Feb 15 to March 08.           (02/17/2022 per Judge - cancel warrant & set court date)
Sent to GLSO on Feb 16, 2022.

10:22 AM Defendant Christopher J Ellis not in court, Attorney Gerise Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes def called last week . Court issues warrant - forthwith. 

Court Adjourned at 10:23 AM.

Def called requesting to appear via zoom for his court appearance on Feb 15, 2022 as he started experiencing Covid Symptoms this weekend. Def was told because it was an initial appearance, I couldn't provide him the zoom information. I informed the def I could reschedule his court date out another week so he'd have over two weeks to recover. Def requested the case be adjourned further out than that so he could have more time to recover. Def was told to submit his request in writing for the Court's review. Def was given our address.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
